results.meeting_purpose: Technical sync-up meeting for Good Chop project to discuss progress on various initiatives including C@C, OTP, product analytics, and roadmap planning

decisions.what: Update primary metric to total delivered orders and net activations for C@C
decisions.context: Discussed during 2025-12-04 meeting

decisions.what: Use new OTP endpoint instead of handling CRM hacks
decisions.context: Pros include no need for CRM hacks and less reputation/legal risk

decisions.what: Menu pricing pushed to January after Black Friday and Thanksgiving
decisions.context: To get more representative data on price sensitivity

decisions.what: Relaunched checkbox experiment on Nov 4 as 50/50 test: checkbox + no collapsed vs checkbox + collapsed
decisions.context: All established brands have checkbox for NY/CA

decisions.what: Move 'Best Value' label to XL if keeping XL, or to L if switching off XL
decisions.context: Legal issue with 'most popular' label

decisions.what: Recommendation to select just 1 graduation voucher since customers can use any acquisition voucher
decisions.context: OTP graduation strategy discussion

action_items.task: Validate AdTech marketing signals
Set up Order Confirmation CRM email
Set up Lead exclusions in CRM
Complete TB profitability analysis (P0)
Test OTP order creation in staging
Share designs with Yury
Double check with Cori
Align with Seb on header consistency between Framer and WL
Minimize white space to ensure CTA is above the fold and make CTA sticky
Follow-up with Seb
Provide ETA for deliverables after Vini completes bootstrap part
Check marketing mix evolution impact on retention
Check with AP + Dovas for case
Share deck of pics

key_points: C@C (Customer at Checkout) implementation and customer moderated interviews
OTP (One-Time Purchase) development including funnel work, order creation, and graduation strategy
Product Analytics focus on TB profitability analysis and dashboard updates
Data pipeline changes causing drops in Global Actives Retention metrics
2026 Financial Planning with focus on retention (trending 2.9), lower CAC YoY by increasing CVR (18%), and 8% box count increase
Checkbox experiment rollout and testing
Menu pricing sensitivity analysis postponed to January
Wallet banner discount combinations and testing
Shopify integration discussions
Failed payments issues with data extension availability
blockers: C@C blocked by Price service returning empty Description field for MR and KN (correct for HF US)
C@C blocked by payment issues: slow endpoint response (resolved), subscription 'pending' state persistent, errors not passed to front-end
Refunds work via BOB but not Owl
Failed payments - 2 customers not available in data extension
Wallet banner doesn't work with combo discount (with for life)
follow_ups: Meeting with payment and pricing team at 5pm (Alexander Matlin)
Clarify failed payments issues with Yury Trofimov
Circle back on deliverables ETA on Aug 29th
Q1 2026 as barometer to refocus strategy
Test ads attribution once OTP order creation available in staging
Align on graduation voucher strategy with Yury Trofimov
Investigate data pipeline changes impact on historical retention numbers

decisions.context: A necessary configuration setting was present on staging but missing on live, causing menu display issues

decisions.what: Ask town team to review the issue
decisions.context: To get additional review on the voucher and menu configuration problems

Plan menu disappeared when selecting 'one time box' option
Configuration discrepancy between staging and live environments
System showing wrong menu (W52 menu recognized but displaying 'classic box free cut' instead of GPU-specific menu)
Price initially showed as zero despite voucher being present
Voucher value of minus 50 was observed

blockers.issue: Missing configuration setting on live environment

blockers.impact: System showing 'classic box free cut' instead of GPU-specific menu despite recognizing W52 menu

follow_ups: Town team review of the voucher and configuration issues

Confirmation that voucher clearing works properly after fix

results.doc_title: Influencer MP: EOY Review - 2025/12/18 15:59 CET - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: End of year review for Influencer Marketplace project to review last year's research findings and plan for next year, focusing on customer and creator interviews

decisions.what: Proceed with building at least one side of the platform (customer-facing) without waiting for all research to complete
decisions.context: To maintain delivery speed while research continues, though sequencing challenges exist due to supply-driven nature of platform

decisions.what: Continue with customer and creator interviews through the end of the year
decisions.context: Seven participants for concept evaluation completed, with last session scheduled for Friday; 12 influencer interviews completed (more than expected)

action_items.task: Complete final creator interview session
Set up follow-up conversations regarding product-market fit findings
Add vacation schedules to shared document
Continue on project through transition period
Work first week of January then transition to other projects

key_points: Influencers view the marketplace concept positively and see high potential value in addressing ingredient sourcing friction for their audiences
Creators demand clear monetization structure and efficient low-effort recipe uploads (e.g., automated nutrition facts)
Strong demand for enhanced filtering options on creator profiles, particularly for dietary needs like dairy-free and gluten-free
Concerns raised about potential cost and time impact of vetting process
Customer interviews showed high enthusiasm for marketplace concept with preference for low-commitment purchase models
Need for creator trust established through verified badges, transparent reviews, and links to original social media videos
Proposal to integrate vetted creator recipes into HelloFresh's active meal selection for existing subscribers, with creators paid per recipe shipment
Strong initial signs of potential product-market fit in both directions (creators and customers)
Challenge regarding sequencing of customer-facing versus creator-facing capabilities due to supply-driven nature of platform
blockers: Sequencing challenge: platform is supply-driven but need to determine whether to build customer-facing or creator-facing capabilities first
Vetting process concerns regarding cost and time impact on creators
Need for operational efficiency and clear ROI for creators to participate
follow_ups: Research next steps to be determined with Katheryn Eckles continuing on project
Follow-up conversations on product-market fit findings
Decisions on creator side of platform once customer side progresses
Explore recipe modularity features to allow creators to easily modify recipes for dietary accommodations
Clarify creator landing page actions and information

entities.name: Influencer MP
entities.context: Influencer Marketplace project being reviewed for end of year progress

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Parent platform that could integrate creator recipes into active meal selection; existing features like meat kit swapping could be leveraged

entities.name: Katheryn Eckles
entities.context: Led research efforts including 12 influencer interviews and customer concept evaluations; received praise for high quality insights work

entities.name: Annette MvdE
entities.context: Project leader who welcomed team and facilitated the review; transitioning out in January but available first week

entities.name: Sameer Doda
entities.context: Provided updates on scoping MVP for one-time purchase experience; managing platform development decisions

entities.name: Nikita Gorshkov
entities.context: Involved in platform development decisions and sequencing discussions

entities.name: Megan Thee Scallion
entities.context: Proposed integrating vetted creator recipes into HelloFresh's meal selection with per-shipment creator payment model; based in Toronto HQ

entities.name: MVP
entities.context: Minimum viable product being scoped for one-time purchase experience

results.doc_title: Influencer MP: EOY Review - 2025/12/18 15:59 CET - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: End of year review for Influencer Marketplace project to review last year's research findings and plan for next year, focusing on customer and creator interviews

decisions.what: Proceed with building at least one side of the platform (customer-facing) without waiting for final decisions on creator-facing capabilities
decisions.context: To maintain delivery speed while addressing the supply-driven nature of the platform and sequencing challenges

decisions.what: Continue with customer and creator interviews to completion
decisions.context: 7 participants for concept evaluation completed, with last session scheduled for Friday; 12 influencer interviews nearly complete (one remaining)

action_items.task: Complete final influencer interview session
Set up follow-up conversations regarding product-market fit findings
Add vacation schedules to shared document
Continue project work and research
Transition project leadership
action_items.timeline: First week of January, then smooth fade out

key_points: Influencers view the marketplace concept positively and see high potential value in addressing ingredient sourcing friction for their audiences
Creators demand clear monetization structure and efficient low-effort recipe uploads (e.g., automated nutrition facts)
Strong desire for enhanced filtering options on creator profiles, particularly for dietary needs like dairy-free and gluten-free
Concerns raised about potential cost and time impact of the vetting process
Customer interviews showed high enthusiasm for marketplace concept with preference for low-commitment purchase models
Need for creator trust established through verified badges, transparent reviews, and links to original social media videos
Proposal to integrate vetted creator recipes into HelloFresh's active meal selection for existing subscribers, with creators paid per recipe shipment
Strong initial signs of potential product-market fit in both directions (creators and customers)
Sameer Doda provided updates on scoping MVP for one-time purchase experience

blockers.issue: Sequencing challenge regarding customer-facing versus creator-facing capabilities due to supply-driven nature of platform
blockers.context: Need to determine which side of the marketplace to build first while maintaining momentum

blockers.issue: Creator concerns about vetting process cost and time impact
blockers.context: May affect creator willingness to participate in platform

blockers.issue: Need for operational efficiency and clear ROI for creators
blockers.context: Critical for creator adoption and retention

follow_ups: Finalize recommendations and plans for next year based on research findings
Determine monetization structure details for creators
Explore recipe modularity features leveraging existing HelloFresh capabilities (e.g., meat kit swapping)
Make decisions on creator-facing platform features once customer-facing side progresses
Research next steps to be determined with Katheryn Eckles continuing on project

results.doc_title: OTP Topics - 2025/12/29 16:00 CET - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: To resolve outstanding VMS launch blockers for OTP with the goal of going live next week

decisions.what: Defer refund payment issue to week two
decisions.context: Refund payment error on OTP can be resolved after launch, prioritizing the first two blockers (Katana and Salesforce events) as R&D blockers for launch

decisions.what: Escalate to incident if no response by 12 PM Berlin time next day
decisions.context: If respective teams don't respond to outreach about the first two issues by noon Berlin time, the team will escalate the matter

decisions.what: Investigate manual refund process for interim solution
decisions.context: To handle refund requests manually during the first week of launch while the refund payment issue is being resolved

action_items.task: Contact Marat and Arem from plans squad regarding event production issues
action_items.timeline: Before 12 PM Berlin time the following day

action_items.task: Reach out to customer care team about manual refund process
Investigate event emission issue and update thread
action_items.timeline: Before 12 PM Berlin time the following day

action_items.task: Ping Nikita on payment channel thread
Update grow go kit library to handle new business division for refund payments

key_points: Three main blockers identified: events not received in Katana, Salesforce not receiving OTP events, and error during refund payments on OTP
Issues manifested immediately in the first two live internal orders
Functional testing was successful on staging, but Katana and Salesforce events needed live testing
Orders are created successfully and visible in 'all' or Bob, but communications to Katana and Salesforce are not triggered
Missing events mean customers would not receive physical products
The orchestrator 'ops' likely emits the missing events
Problem might be related to business division requiring grow go kit library or configuration issue like 'factor market' not being enabled
blockers: Events not being received in Katana (R&D blocker for launch)
Salesforce not receiving OTP events (R&D blocker for launch)
Error during refund payments on OTP (deferred to week two)
Lack of ability to test Katana and Salesforce parts in staging environment
Possible configuration issue with 'factor market' not being enabled
Business division issue requiring grow go kit library update
follow_ups: Response from Marat and Arem from plans squad about event issues
Manual refund process establishment with customer care team
Resolution of grow go kit library update for refund payments in week two
Potential escalation to incident if no response by deadline

results.doc_title: Nikita / Prateek (Deep Dive) - 2025/12/05 13:04 CET - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: Deep dive discussion on content strategy and app development for pet health tracking

decisions.what: Develop a pet app to measure and communicate pet health improvements
decisions.context: To improve social proof and retention by showing users that products improve pet health

decisions.what: Add questions to existing commercial team surveys to understand pet owner concerns
decisions.context: To identify top 5 worries/thoughts of pet owners before building app features

decisions.what: Define smallest possible product and test ideas before committing significant resources
decisions.context: Company has weak history in content strategies and wants to build confidence incrementally

decisions.what: Offer basic tracking capabilities to all pet owners who download app, not just active customers
decisions.context: To maximize engagement and potential user base

action_items.task: Start work on login page and write one-pager for review with stage one and stage two plans
Send Lindsay's contact and add Prateek to TPT team for survey visibility
Work with Katrina to ensure right survey questions are asked
Ensure Katrina has bandwidth for design work and push back on distractions

key_points: Company has weak history in content strategies and daily active user increases
Target power users are 'dinks' (Dual Income, No Kids) in metro areas who pamper their pets
Average US spend per dog is $1.6k per year (highest globally)
Commercial team runs surveys every 2 weeks or monthly with good response rates
App should help measure and communicate health improvements rather than waiting for customers to notice
Health measurement and communication could solve retention problem (similar to Amazon Prime utility)
Pet owners have emotional attachment and perceive pets as children

blockers.context: Concerns about designer availability due to distractions from senior director

follow_ups: Review one-pager for stage one and stage two plans
Access latest survey results (last available from August)
Prateek to speak with Yara (dog owner, represents target audience middle ground)
Incorporate survey findings into app feature prioritization
